intro: Neea glomeruliflora var. coniungens, commonly known as the clustered-flowered neea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, providing a striking contrast to the delicate flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
